title: ZK I Zettel 7,2mb3 - Niklas Luhmann-Archiv
body: 7,2mb3 Ähnlich wie hier auch Cantril, S. 296ff. – z.B.S. 296: "the function of this 'value inquiry' [= Rechtfertigungs-prozess], is to provide us with a value judgement thatwill serve as a compass, a directive for action. In 'valueinquiry' we are seeking standards of rightness, wrongness,more right than, goodness, badness, beauty, ugliness,etc. which will serve as signs or cues and which willindicate to us the nature of the probable consequenceswe will experience by following a particular course ofaction". Ähnlich wohl auch Hans Reiner, der z.B. in Symphilosophein, S. 295 denWertbegriff als Wahlgesichtspunkt für Entscheidungen behandelt.Evtl. zuziehen sein Buch Pflicht und Neigung, 1951. Tead, S. 50: "A value in this sense is an influence which is heldin high regard by the individual […] to an extent sufficientto help determine his choices of behavior."
